row.Docu:
= Action name = PCK.AUTOMIC_VMWARE_VSPHERE.PUB.ACTION.MANAGE_WINDOWS_OSCUSTOMIZATIONSPEC
= General description = This action creates or modifies an existing Windows OS customization in a vCenter server for the given specifications.
If Naming scheme is "Not Specified", then naming prefix should be empty.
= Failure Conditions = * Zero/Multiple OS customizationspec found or the OS customizationspec is not of 'Windows' type in case of UPDATESPEC. * If 'NamingPrefix' parameter is empty in case of NamingScheme is set to custom, fixed, or prefix. * Neither domain or workgroup is provide, or both are given. * If Domain is provided but its credentials (domain username/domain password) are not provided.
= Inputs = * Server IP or DNS : Specify IP address or DNS name of the vSphere server to which you want to connect. E.g. www.myvcenter.com * Username : Username which will be used for this connection. E.g. domain\username * Password : Password to your username. * Port : Specify port which will be used for connection. E.g. 8080 * Protocol : Specify protocol you want to use for connection. E.g. https, http * Action : Specify whether if you want to create a new or update an existing OS Customization Specification. Valid values are CREATESPEC and UPDATESPEC. * OS Customization Spec name : Specify a name of specification you want to create or update. E.g myWinSpec * Description : Provide description for the specification. * Admin password : Specify a new OS administrator's password. * Auto Logon count : Specify the number of times the Virtual Machine automatically logs in as admin without prompting for user credentials. 0 disables auto log on. E.g. 4 * Change SID : Indicate if that the customization should modify the system security identifier. Valid values are YES or NO. * Delete Accounts : Indicate that you want to delete all user accounts. Valid values are YES or NO. * Domain : Specify a domain name. E.g. test.com * Workgroup : Specify a workgroup. E.g. Engineers * Domain username : Specify the name you want to use for domain authentication. * Domain password : Specify the password you want to use for domain authentication. * Full name : Specify the administrator's full name. E.g. myName * Organization name : Specify the name of the organization to which the administrator belongs. E.g. myOrganization * GUI Run Once commands : Specify a list of commands to run when a user logs in for the first time. * License Mode : Select the license mode of the Win 2000/2003 guest OS. Valid values are NOTSPECIFIED, PERSEAT and PERSERVER. * License Max Connections : Specify the maximum connections for server license mode. Used only if the LicenseMode parameter is set to Perserver. 0 specifies no connections. E.g. 30 * Product key : Specify Microsoft product key. Valid values are NOTSPECIFIED, CUSTOM, FIXED, PREFIX and VM. * Time Zone : Specify the name or ID of the time zone for OS. E.g. Specify the name or ID of the time zone for OS. * Naming Scheme : Select the naming scheme for the virtual machine. * Naming Prefix : Specify naming prefix depending on selected naming scheme - Custom, NamingPrefix, or Prefix. * Overwrite Agent : Overwrites the default agent * Overwrite Login : Overwrites the default login
= Behaviour = (none)
=Return Value= (none)
= Outputs = * Return code is 0 in case of success. * Return code is 1 in case of failure.
= Logging = Logs will be displayed in the AE report.
= Example = (none)
